summary: This document is a series of forwarded FBI emails from April 2021 coordinating assistance for Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team's review of evidence at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse in New York. It details the logistics, security, and scheduling for the evidence review sessions.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell is the defendant whose defense team is reviewing evidence at the courthouse; she is to be produced by the Marshals and monitored by FBI agents.

events.title: Start of Maxwell evidence review
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team begin reviewing evidence at 500 Pearl Street courthouse, with FBI agents providing security and monitoring.

events.title: Email coordination for evidence review assistance
events.description: FBI emails are exchanged to request and coordinate agent assistance for Maxwell's evidence review, noting the review will continue the next day.

events.title: Continuation of evidence review
events.description: Squad C-20 advises that the evidence review with Maxwell and her defense team will continue, with assistance requested from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm.

locations: 500 Pearl Street, New York (courthouse location where evidence review takes place, specifically the 5th floor proffer room area)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody and undergoing evidence review with her defense team at the 500 Pearl Street courthouse in April 2021.
The FBI's Squad C-20 was responsible for coordinating security and monitoring during the evidence review, requiring agents with handcuff keys to escort Maxwell.
The evidence review was scheduled for multiple days (starting April 13) and involved reserved proffer rooms for evidence, defense conferences, and breaks.
An AUSA (Assistant United States Attorney) was present for the evidence review sessions.
